events.message: Customer reported a rear-end vehicle collision that occurred at a traffic light on April 30th, resulting in moderate damage to the rear bumper and trunk.
The claim was reviewed and classified under the Auto Accident category due to vehicle damage caused by collision.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to oversee this vehicle accident claim and communicate with the claimant.
The insurer has formally acknowledged the receipt of the accident claim and assured the claimant of prompt proceedings.
Request sent to the claimant for vehicle repair estimates, accident report from the police, and photographs of the damaged areas.
The claimant submitted the requested police report, repair shop’s damage assessment, and multiple images showing the rear-end damage.
The investigation team began reviewing submitted documents and preparing to verify the circumstances around the vehicle accident.
Investigation concluded that the claimant was not at fault in the collision and vehicle damage aligns with the accident description.
A fair settlement covering the full cost of repairs and a rental vehicle was proposed to the claimant for approval.
The claimant expressed appreciation for the timely handling of the claim and accepted the proposed settlement without reservations.
Final approval was granted by the claims manager following claimant’s acceptance of the settlement terms.
The payment for vehicle repairs and associated rental costs has been processed and transferred to the claimant’s account.
The vehicle accident claim was officially closed following successful settlement payment and no further outstanding issues.
All case documents related to this auto accident claim have been archived securely for future reference and compliance.
